abstracts.cdata!:
This report is a project performance
            review of the Program Loan Project in Peru. On May 17, 1979,
            the Bank signed a $115 million program loan with the
            Republic of Peru which had been approved by the Board on May
            1. The loan was designed to help meet foreign exchange
            requirements for high priority imports and technical
            assistance in support of the Government's Economic
            Recovery Program (ERP), a comprehensive package of
            short-term and structural economic policy measures.
            Disbursement of the loan was completed on July 15, 1981.
            Over 95 percent of the loan, however, had been disbursed by
            June 30, 1980, the original closing date. Three supervision
            missions visited Peru to determine whether progress under
            the ERP was satisfactory, as a basis for release of loan
            tranches. Information gathered by these and other missions
            as well as the views expressed in Government reports on the
            loan and the ERP are reflected in this completion report.
